fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives: The ECPMF acknowledges the role of the EU members states on a national level in matters of media policy. However, it stresses the importance of the EU in this issue. The ECPMF, together with its partners, closely observes EU initiatives, strategies and legislative processes inter alia on whistle-blowing protection, data protection, defamation, access to information, public-service broadcasting, (self-)censorship, and financing of journalism.
organisation_name: Europäisches Zentrum für Presse- und Medienfreiheit (ECPMF)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: “Forum Media and Development” (Forum Medien und Entwicklung) - http://fome.info/
relevant_communication: The ECPMF is facilitating activities according to actual needs. The Centre carries out advocacy, diplomatic and lobbying initiatives, with the aim for better awareness, regulations and legal initiatives for the protection of journalists. In “Fact-finding missions” the ECPMF conducts research and analyses on-the-spot in cooperation with partners, experts and affected people in the country after which it drafts recommendations, petitions and statements to the EU and its member states. Besides making concrete demands, the Centre also offers expertise on media freedom and media policy to political stakeholders. Through its website, social media, newsletter, events, solidarity actions and campaigns, the ECPMF aims to raise awareness for media freedom violations on a pan-European scale and tries to keep media freedom on the political agenda.
